Comments_List: The course offered us insights into contemporary Latin American politics and inequality in the region, ranging from subjects of corruption, partisanship, to political violence.
The course was extremely well facilitated to encourage student learning, our discussions were very engaging and the material was very interesting.

If you are looking for a medium-work introduction to politics and inequality in Latin America then this course is solid. Professor de la O is smart and many of the readings were quite interesting. That being said, much of the class material is pretty general and many of the class discussions were a little sleepy.
Yes, I would recommend this course to any student with an interest in Latin American politics.
